title: Grandma's Chicken Soup Recipe
description: Grandma's chicken soup is the ultimate comfort food and the only remedy for whatever ails you! Packed with root vegetables, this soup cures everything!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Chicken Soup Recipes Grandma's Chicken Soup 5.0 (1) 1 Review 1 Photo Make this chicken soup whenever you're feeling under the weather. It's sure to make you feel better! You can freeze the soup in portions so it's available whenever needed. For a hearty touch, serve with egg noodles. Submitted by Love2c0ok Updated on December 17, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 35 mins Cook Time: 3 hrs 30 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 4 hrs 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (5 pound) whole chicken 1 pound carrots, peeled and sliced 1 pound celery, sliced 2 tomatoes, seeded and chopped 1 large onion, chopped 1 bunch fresh dill 1 tablespoon salt 1 tablespoon ground black pepper 10 cups warm water as needed Directions Clean chicken, remove and discard some, but not all, fat. Place in a large saucepan with carrots, celery, tomatoes, and onion. Tie dill sprigs into a bunch with kitchen twine. Add to the saucepan, and season with salt and pepper. Add water until chicken is covered by 2 inches. Cook over medium-low heat until chicken is cooked through, about 3 hours. Remove chicken to a plate and allow to cool, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove meat from bones, cut into bite-size pieces, and return to the saucepan. Discard bones. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through, about 30 minutes longer. Remove dill before serving. Cook's Note: If you prefer not to add tomato, as some of my family members do, simply place a whole tomato in the pot for flavor and remove it once the soup is done. name: Love2c0ok
instructions: Clean chicken, remove and discard some, but not all, fat. Place in a large saucepan with carrots, celery, tomatoes, and onion.;Tie dill sprigs into a bunch with kitchen twine. Add to the saucepan, and season with salt and pepper. Add water until chicken is covered by 2 inches.;Cook over medium-low heat until chicken is cooked through, about 3 hours. Remove chicken to a plate and allow to cool, 15 to 20 minutes.;Remove meat from bones, cut into bite-size pieces, and return to the saucepan. Discard bones. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through, about 30 minutes longer. Remove dill before serving.
